Title: Instagram handle owner seeks settlement with artist Subodh Gupta
Content:
This story is from February 5, 2020

NEW DELHI: An anonymous Instagram handle that had posted sexual harassment allegations against artist Subodh Gupta on Tuesday offered to seek an amicable settlement with him.

The owner of the Instagram account ‘ Herdsceneand ’, through counsel, submitted before the Delhi high court that sh/e was exploring if the dispute with Gupta — who has filed a defamation suit asking for Rs 5 crore in damages — could be settled out of court and sought a week’s time.

Justice Rajiv Sahai Endlaw had, on the last date of hearing, asked the holder of the account to clarify if sh/e wanted to represent only the anonymous 'victim' (who has claimed sexual harassment by Gupta) or all such persons who have used the platform offered by the account to level charges against other men.

Appearing for the artist, advocate Neoma Vasdev said his client’s reputation has been damaged but he is willing to wait and see what the other party has in mind by way of a resolution, prompting the HC to grant a week’s time.

The 'victim' has not yet been arrayed as a party in the case while the identity of the person running the Instagram account, which published allegations against several men in the wake of #MeToo movement, has been kept secret on the court’s directions for the time being.

The HC order, seeking clarification on where the account holder stands in the defamation suit, came after the holder earlier revealed sh/e is only a “whistleblower” and has not been harassed by Gupta. The person said the handle is only a neutral platform intended to bring out instances of sexual misconduct and harassment in the art fraternity, as part of the #MeToo movement.

Justice Endlaw took a dim view of this revelation, pointing out that a “ghost” can’t be allowed to have a “superghost”.

The account holder had also stated that in the absence of an internal committee to deal with such instances, the victims of sexual harassment wrote to it about their personal experiences, knowing that the anonymity offered by the platform would protect them from retaliation in the hands of influential members of the art fraternity. The HC, however, had disagreed, noting, “On one side you reveal the other person's identity but you do not want to reveal your identity.” It underlined that Gupta has the right to know who is levelling the allegations since the other party has not initiated any legal proceedings.

Gupta had filed a defamation suit against ‘Herdsceneand’ and others last year, following the publication of anonymous sexual harassment allegations against him.

Title: Underworld don Gawli moves HC for parole citing wife’s ill health
Content:
This story is from February 5, 2020

Nagpur: Underworld don Arun Gawli has once again knocked the judiciary’s doors for seeking parole of 45 days, this time for attending his ailing wife Asha. Earlier, he had sought leave for looking after his old mother, who later passed away.

A division bench comprising justices Pradeep Deshmukh and Pushpa Ganediwala on Tuesday issued notices to state government and other respondents asking them to reply within two weeks.

The gangster-cum-politician had moved the Nagpur bench of Bombay high court through counsel Mir Nagman Ali praying for grant of the parole. Earlier, his application for parole was rejected by the divisional commissioner on the grounds that his presence many led to law and order situation in Mumbai, after which he moved HC .

The noted gangster was convicted for murder of Shiv Sena MLA Kamalakar Jamsandekar on August 3, 2012 along with 11 others and was awarded rigorous life imprisonment.

He was first released on parole on May 5, 2015, and then on furlough on April 13, 2016. He was again set off on parole on October 21 in same year and on furlough on April 2017.

Last year also, the HC had granted furlough to Gawli in March.

All five times, the Mumbai don reported back before the deadline for surrendering before the jail authorities, Ali said.

Title: BCC&I meet on street vendors
Content:
This story is from February 5, 2020

Kolkata: The Bengal Chamber of Commerce and Industry (BCC&I) on Monday organized a training for street vendors , as part of a year-long CSR initiative.

The initiative will culminate in a food festival on 22 February. The project titled, “Apish Parar Khabar” or the Dalhousie Street food, is aimed at empowering Kolkata’s street vendors. Among those who attended the inauguration was Pranav Singh, president, Hotel and Restaurants Association of Eastern India (HRAEI).

“The idea is to introduce the concepts of sanitation, environment, food safety, health, hygiene and culinary skills to the street vendors,” said Singh.

Title: Kolkata Metro: 8am on Valentine’s Day;Your date with East-West Metro
Content:
Final trial runs of East-West Metro trains will be held on Wednesday

KOLKATA: Railway minister Piyush Goyal will unveil the East-West Metro on February 13 but you will get to ride the swanky coaches the day after, on Valentine’s Day.On February 14, the trains will chug out of Sector V and Salt Lake Stadium stations at 8am. The ticket counters will open at 7.45am. The last trains from both the stations will leave at 8pm and ticket counters will close at 7.55pm. This will also be the general schedule that will be followed for the curtailed 5km services. Sunday services will start late, though. The first trains will start at noon but the closing time will remain the same — 8pm.Initially, it was decided that commuters will be able to avail themselves of East-West services on February 13 itself, immediately after the inauguration. But officials said the inauguration ceremony on February 13 may commence in the afternoon and not in the morning as was planned earlier, when the authorities had prepared the schedule for a December launch.Initially, Metro will run 37 pairs of services between Salt Lake Sector V and Salt Lake Stadium. Trains will run at an interval of 20 minute initially but the frequency may be tweaked depending on footfall and demand. Of the 11 BEML rakes that are in Metro’s possession now, two would be used for daily services while a third will be kept on standby. The rakes used will not be the same every day. Of the 11 rakes, about six have been fitted with necessary equipment till now. All of them will be tried out on a rotational basis.“We will have 18 motormen who have been trained in Bengaluru. They have also received training in Hyderabad about the Communication Based Train Control (CBTC) system. They are now fully adept at aligning trains with the platform screen doors at stations. On Sundays, we shall start services from noon. There will be 25 pairs of services on Sundays but this can change depending on demand. It takes 13 minutes to complete the journey from Salt Lake Sector V to Salt Lake Stadium. So two rakes will be sufficient to operate along the stretch. One rake will be kept on standby,” said a senior official of Metro Railway .The first phase will cover six swank elevated stations. Central Park is the only single-floor station where the platform and the concourse are on the same level. It has three platforms, the third one will be used for trains to enter from the depot, which is right next to this station. From Central Park station, the train will travel to the terminal Sector V station and start its journey.More than 100 Metro staff members have now taken over the section from Kolkata Metro Rail Corporation (KMRC), which is implementing the East-West Metro project. Even as KMRC is implementing the project, Metro Railway, which runs the north-south section, will be in charge of operations.“We have trained all drivers and other staff from Metro Railway to operate the CBTC and signalling systems and run trains from the operation control centre, maintain signals and halt the trains in coordination with the platform screen gates,” a KMRC official said.

Title: IIT-BHU, IIT-K to arm UP def corridor with tech, manpower
Content:
This story is from February 5, 2020

Lucknow: Close on the heels of mega defence exhibition DefExpo-2020, which begins in Lucknow on Wednesday, IIT-BHU and IIT-Kanpur are set to disseminate knowledge, conduct quality research and play a key role in skill development in defence sector.

UP government has joined hands with both the IITs to establish centre of excellence for defence industrial corridor and start certificate courses.

Dean, research and development (IIT-BHU) Rajiv Prakash said the institute was likely to start certificate courses for skill development in defence industries.

“We will promote indigenous defence industries and startups as beginners will not have hi-tech research and will need knowledge support, which will be provided by the institute,” he said.

“Suppose a new startup or an indigenous defence industry decides to manufacture a particular arm but faces problem regarding metals or alloys used in it, we at IIT-BHU will be the knowledge partner for the industry,” he said.

Prakash said such problems could not be resolved easily as defence industrial units keep their technical know-how confidential and in such cases IIT would help new startups.

“We will be of great help to international defence industries setting up units in UP. We will provide them trained hands by developing manpower. We will soon start certificate courses in skill development in defence sector,” he added.

Similarly, IIT-Kanpur will be instrumental in sharing knowledge in the field of advanced research in nanomaterial, cybersecurity, UAVs and electronics, and communication.

Title: Colvale fort to soon get facelift
Content:
This story is from February 5, 2020

Panaji: Plans are afoot to undertake restoration of Colvale ’s St Minguel Fort which dates to 1635.

“We have sent a proposal for its restoration to the state government. Work is expected to start sometime after monsoon this year, following necessary sanctions from the government,” an official from the directorate or archaeology said.

Eleven forts across the state are notified under the Goa Ancient Monuments and Archaeological Sites and Remains Act of 1978 and Rules 1980. Under this, regular inspections and maintenance work such as debris clearance, vegetation clearance and minor repairs of the forts are carried out every year.

The Colvale fort, however, needs further attention in terms of structural conservation.

“For now, clearing of vegetation around the premises, routine cleaning and installation of dustbins at the fort are regularly done. But this fort needs to be restored. We will take this up as a major project this year,” the official said.

The fort is believed to have been built by the Portuguese as a barrier against the inroads of the Marathas and Bhonsles.

Title: Tiger that killed cattle at Huland caught on camera
Content:
This story is from February 5, 2020

Keri: Within days of four buffaloes being attacked and one cow being killed in Huland along the Karnataka-Maharashtra border just outside the Mhadei Wildlife Sanctuary, the state’s forest department has managed to trap images of the tiger.

Stating that these latest images clearly established tiger presence in the Mhadei Wildlife Sanctuary, range forest officer (RFO) of Kankumbi, Kavitha Y, told TOI, “We have the camera trap image of the tiger that killed a buffalo in Huland. We are now in the process of verifying whether it has moved from the Mhadei sanctuary into Huland.”

While the state forest department was not able to trap images of the tiger that killed a cow in Derode just days earlier, it was able to do so in Huland.

On January 28, the tiger killed four buffaloes at Nisaniche Mal in Huland. The animal, however, could not eat its kill as the villagers drove it away. On January 29, the big cat attacked at Hal in Huland where it killed and ate a cow partially. Confident that the tiger would return to its kill, forest officials set up a camera trap and were successful is securing evidence that it was indeed a tiger that had killed the cow.

Incidents of tigers attacking cattle in the Mhadei Wildlife Sanctuary have showed an increased frequency since January. Among the cattle claimed by tigers are a cow in Derode, a sub-adult bull in Satre, a sub-adult buffalo in Surla, all in Sattari, and most recently, four buffaloes in the reserve forest of Huland bordering Goa.

As per information and evidence collected by state forests officials and verified with Karnataka forests officials, it has been established that the tiger that killed the cow in Derode came from the Kali Tiger Reserve in Joida, Karnataka. The big cat travelled more than 100km into the Mhadei Wildlife Sanctuary, forest officials said.

“The Tillari region bordering Goa and Karnataka has tigers. We have evidence of the presence of a tigress and two cubs in the Tillari valley. There is urgent need for coordinated efforts by forests officials of Goa, Maharashtra and Karnataka to protect them,” wildlifer Girish Punjabi, who is studying the presence of tigers in Tillari, told TOI.

Title: India for better ties, trade with Africa, to roll out red carpet
Content:
This story is from February 5, 2020

Lucknow: The 11th Defence Expo beginning in the state capital from Wednesday will host an India-Africa conclave for the first time in the history of the biennial event. The conclave assumes significance as India has been seeking to strengthen military ties with African nations, especially at a time when China is making inroads in the continent.

Both Union and UP governments will be rolling out a red carpet for around 14 defence ministers from African nations attending the expo and seek better strategic ties.

India’s engagement is not limited to inviting investment from African nations, but also to look for markets for its defence production under ‘Make In India’ scheme.

“We will explore their markets along with the possibility of a mutually beneficial trade relationship between India and African nations. This includes not just investments in India, which of course would be very welcome, but also the possibility of new markets for Indian defence goods,” said a senior government official.

The conclave, to be held on February 6, will be presided over by defence minister Rajnath Singh.

UP chief minister’s office said Democratic Republic of Congo, Madagascar, Gambia, Lesotho, Sudan, Tanzania, Rwanda, Niger, Seychelles, Uganda, Zambia, Republic of Sao Tome and Principe, Zimbabwe and Namibia have already confirmed their participation in the conclave and Defence Expo.

A ministry of defence official affirmed that it was for the first time that an India-Africa Defence Conclave is being organized during Defence Expo.

As part of increasing India’s military outreach among African nations, air chief marshal RKS Bhadauria visited Egypt last December for talks with top military brass of the country. The Indian Army conducted its first Africa-India field training exercise in March 2019, in which 18 countries, including Egypt, participated.

After taking over as defence minister, Singh’s first foreign visit was to Mozambique, while chief of defence staff Bipin Rawat also visited Tanzania and Kenya when he was army chief.

India has also been holding defence cooperation talks with Botswana, Morocco, Namibia, Nigeria and Uganda.

Title: Sealdah station to start before East-West Metro’s second phase completion
Content:
This story is from February 5, 2020

The subsidence in an area in Bowbazar has delayed the East-West project by several months

KOLKATA: Metro Railway will not wait for the completion of East-West Metro’s second phase to throw open the Sealdah station, general manager Manoj Joshi told TOI on Tuesday.

The first phase, between Salt Lake Sector V and Salt Lake Stadium, which will be thrown open for commercial services on February 13, will hopefully be extended till Phoolbagan around May. Though a date has not been fixed for extension till Sealdah, it will happen before completion of work from the Esplanade side.

“One tunnel-boring machine (TBM) is stuck underground. The other one will have to be sent to complete the tunnel between Esplanade and Sealdah. There are issues pending before Calcutta high court. Hopefully, the stretch from Howrah Maidan to Sealdah would be ready for commissioning in two years. But we will not wait that long for commissioning the Sealdah station and linking it to the stretch up to Salt Lake Sector V. Work for completion of the Sealdah station is continuing. As soon as the technical issues involving sending off the second TBM to complete the tunnelling is resolved, we plan to start operations between Salt Lake Sector V and Sealdah,” Joshi said.

Operationalization of the Sealdah station is crucial in the grand scheme of things as footfall will increase once the network is connected to a major transport hub. In fact, even before construction of the corridor had started, railway experts like D C Mitra had suggested that work be started from Sealdah towards both directions. They had suggested that truncated services be thrown open as soon as a new station was completed. This would ensure a steady flow of passengers. Phase I of the the corridor will actually not be of great help to those commuting to work from Salt Lake to central Kolkata. It would be popular among those who wish to reach EM Bypass quicker and more comfortably.

“Once the corridor gets connected to Sealdah, passenger count will go up manifold. People from Salt Lake who work in central Kolkata or even in the south or north would just need to reach Sealdah for a comfortable ride home. Even those who travel to the suburbs on work would benefit. This is why there is an urgency to complete the stretch till Sealdah. We can’t wait for two years for this connectivity to take place. Once the connectivity to Phoolbagan is completed, there will be an increase in the number of passengers and the number of services may have to be increased. Once we link Sealdah to the network, not only services, we will also have to extend the timings as many people would be leaving home early or returning late,” a Metro official added.

Title: Cong slams Lobo’s call to legalise matka
Content:
This story is from February 5, 2020

Saligao: President of Congress’ Aldona block Amaranth Panjikar, on Tuesday condemned waste management minister and Calangute legislator Michael Lobo’s demand to legalise matka (gambling). He said that the legalisation of matka would spoil the state’s social fabric.

Lobo had advocated the legalisation of matka, stating that it was causing a huge loss to the state exchequer as goods and services tax (GST) was not levied on it. Lobo had also stated that matka could be brought under the purview of the law and GST could be levied on the game.

“By attempting to legalise matka, the government is sending out a wrong message, especially to jobless youth, to take up vices,” Panjikar told reporters.

Title: Trapped croc rescued from Mardol stream
Content:
This story is from February 5, 2020

Ponda: A 12-foot-long adult male crocodile was rescued from the bank of a stream at Mardol, on Tuesday.

The mugger, who was trapped in a cable snare laid to poach wild boar, has sustained injuries to his nose and face, animal rescuer Sricharan Desai, said.

He further said that the reptile weighed around 450kg and could well be over 40 years old. It is likely to have gotten trapped in the snare after it came onto the bank in search of food, Desai added.

Animal rescue volunteers were summoned by the local panch member, Varad Mardolkar, after locals noticed the crocodile in distress.

“These sweet water muggers are not man-eaters and feed on fish or small creatures found in water. It seems to have been hungry for several days as it was weak,” Desai said, adding that the animal will be released at a suitable place on Friday.

Title: Kolkata’s Tube Railway plan nipped in bud a century ago
Content:
This story is from February 5, 2020

Metro Railway could well have celebrated 2025-26 as its centenary year had the British gone ahead with their p... Read More

KOLKATA: Metro Railway could well have celebrated 2025-26 as its centenary year had the British gone ahead with their plans for a ‘Tube Railway Scheme’ in Kolkata. Ahead of commissioning of the Metro’s second line in the city, a senior official has dug into archives to retrieve documents on how the British had planned a network akin to the London Underground in Kolkata way back in 1919. The London Underground started in 1863. According to the official, there may have been an earlier plan but he is yet to retrieve documents to establish this.

As per records, for the British, a Metro network in the city was not a novelty but an essential to allow people reach their workplaces on time. They were keen that people avoid the additional expenses of living in the city and migrate to places like ‘Dum Dum and Baraset’. At the same time, they were worried that such people would not be able to reach their offices on time and get chastised by their bosses or be penalized. Following which, the September session of the Imperial Legislative Council at ‘Simla’ in 1919, followed a motion moved by Sir W E Crum, set up a committee that recommended a Metro for Kolkata after 14 sittings.

“We are of opinion that direct communication between the suburban stations and the business centre is required to enable suburban passengers to reach their destination without a change of vehicle. Requirements can only be met satisfactorily by the provision of an east and west tube railway from Eastern Bengal Railway to the East Indian Railway,” the committee had recommended. However, things didn’t move smoothly thereafter. The agency appointed to study the business aspects of the project stated in its report that the ‘three annas’ to be charged from passengers would not meet the costs involved in such a project.

“I found the documents tucked away in a museum of the Railway Board. The matter didn’t end in 1919. In 1921, the then Railway Board appointed one Dalrymple-Hay, consulting engineer to the Tube Railways in London, to study the possibility of a Metro network in Kolkata. It seems that Hay was actually born in Birbhum, West Bengal, before moving to England . In 1921, he was busy in restoring the London Underground stations and sent his chief assistant Ogilvie to carry out a study in Kolkata. The cost of the project that would connect the city with Howrah was pegged at £3,526,154. It was estimated that the project would take four-and-a-half years to complete,” the official said.

Why the project never took off is not too clear. Given the spurt in the Independence struggle following the Jallianwala Bagh massacre, the British may have realised that their days in India were numbered. Less than a decade later, World War II started and no more effort was made to have Tube Railways in Kolkata.

Title: Six, including 3 on 1 bike, die in separate accidents
Content:
This story is from February 5, 2020

Representative image

NAGPUR: Six persons, including three travelling on one bike, were killed in separate incidents in city and district in the last 24 hours. The three persons riding on one bike were killed on Lonara-Gumthala Road at 5.30pm on Tuesday, while another two bikers were crushed under a truck on Mankapur Ring Road. A senior citizen, aged 75, was killed near Kandri in Kanhan in Nagpur rural while two were injured in the same accident on Monday.

Three persons, Nandkishor Pusadkar, Chandrabhan Ingoley and Chindubaji Kakde, were killed after a car rammed into their bike in front of Jhulelal Institute of Engineering on Lonara-Gumthala road on Tuesday. The car was being driven on the wrong side of the road, and the driver lost control and collided with the bikers head-on. The bikers were dragged under the car for at least 10 feet. Pusadkar was driving the bike while the rest two were riding pillion.

The three deceased, residents of Belwada , were heading towards Bokara. The car driver, who fled the place, later got himself admitted at a hospital. The bodies were shifted to Mayo Hospital for post mortem. Police said all three had died on the spot. Koradi police have registered an offence of culpable homicide not amounting to murder against the driver.

Later on Tuesday evening, a biker and his pillion rider came under a truck on Mankapur Ring Road. He too was killed on the spot. An offence was registered against the trucker at Mankapur police station.

In Nagpur rural, 75-year-old Kachrabai Manwatkar was killed after her autorickshaw was rammed by a truck near Kandri. An offence was registered at Kanhan police station.

Title: BJP demands inquiry into Aquem project
Content:
This story is from February 5, 2020

Panaji: BJP has demanded an inquiry into the approvals given by the South Goa Planning and Development Authority to a commercial project at Aquem , Margao.

General secretary of the Margao BJP mandal Navin Pai Raikar, along with party spokesperson Sharmad Raiturkar, have demanded a thorough inquiry into the entire episode of the conversion of an ‘open space’ earlier marked for recreational purposes to settlement.

Raikar said that while the owner’s application for change of zone was rejected as the land was low-lying, it nevertheless was shown as a commercial zone in the 2011 outline development plan (ODP) for Margao. He further said that a sanad was issued by the district collector in 2012 and that permission to develop a mall was issued, following which it was purchased by relatives of opposition leader Digambar Kamat.

Title: Goa College of Architecture needs upgrade, CM told
Content:
This story is from February 5, 2020

Goa College of Architecture has to be elevated to a different level, in particular to a new complex which will... Read More

PANAJI: In a bid to make Goa College of Architecture a permanent hub for showcasing Goa’s architectural identity in terms of building typologies and heritage complex, the Indian Institute of Architects ( IIA ) – Goa Chapter, has made a representation to the chief minister Pramod Sawant regarding up-gradation of the institute besides its relocation to new premises.

“Goa College of Architecture has to be elevated to a different level, in particular to a new complex which will be in tune with the norms set by the Council of Architecture, New Delhi,” IIA Chairman Manguesh Prabhugaonker stated in the proposal to Sawant.

The IIA said that the college could be potentially shifted to the Lyceum Educational Complex in Altinho . Currently housing the high court building, the Lyceum complex is said to have five blocks and could serve as a roof for the institute.

The IIA further stated that they would like to assist the state government with “a long-term institute building strategy and a design friendly road map” to create a design centre in the country.

The architecture college is also planning to start post graduate programmes in architecture– one each in masters in urban design and another in sustainable architecture. Sources said the college is seeking accreditation from the Council of Architecture, which is a pre-requisite to start these programmes in Goa.

IIA Goa chapter suggested the creation of an outdoor museum for the architecture graduates that could help in experimentation through building materials and its application techniques and also to curate a research laboratory

“In addition, IIA would like to facilitate the architecture college in setting up a planning cell that could offer services in architecture and planning in various expertise with resources available among architects practicing in Goa.” the proposal read.

Title: Coronavirus in Delhi: Five test negative for coronavirus
Content:
Indian students, who were recently evacuated from China’s Wuhan, play volleyball at the quarantine centre in Manesar on Tuesday

NEW DELHI: The total number of persons isolated at various Delhi hospitals with suspicion of coronavirus infection has gone up to 12. While seven people with the history of travel to China are admitted at Ram Manohar Lohia (RML) hospital, five others are at Safdarjung Hospital.Officials said admissions had been done as a precautionary measure because they had symptoms such as fever and cough. The tests reports are still awaited.Meanwhile, five of the evacuees, who were shifted to the Army’s Base hospital from Manesar camp, tested negative for coronavirus, an Army source said on Tuesday. “We are not taking any chances. Anyone with history of travel to China, where the novel coronavirus infection is widespread, is being screened and isolated until tests confirm that they don’t have the virus,” said an official.Among those admitted to RML hospital is a 38-year-old man who returned from China on Sunday.At Safdarjung hospital, doctors said, five people admitted to an Indo-Tibetan Border Police (ITBP) facility after being evacuated from coronavirus-affected Wuhan in China were shifted on Tuesday. “Among those shifted are three men and two women. The five have been shifted as a precautionary measure after they showed basic symptoms like cough and sneezing. Some had a medical history,” said a doctor.A total of 406 people have been quarantined at the ITBP facility in Delhi’s Chhawla area since the last week after they were brought in two batches from Wuhan onboard separate Air India flights.ITBP spokesperson Vivek Kumar Pandey said the centre now has “401 inmates and they are being well taken care of”. Another official said that samples of all the people quarantined at the facility have been collected by doctors in coordination with National Centre for Disease Control (NCDC) and Indian Council for Medical Research (ICMR), and they are being sent to laboratories at AIIMS and Pune for further tests.Over 600 Indians were evacuated from Wuhan. The remaining evacuees have been kept at another quarantine facility set up by the Army in Manesar (Gurgaon).According to Chinese government officials, the death toll from the coronavirus epidemic has risen to more than 420 while the number of those affected by the deadly disease has crossed 20,000.India has reported three cases of coronavirus so far, all from Kerala. Delhi has not reported any case of coronavirus so far. However, as a precautionary measure, a public advisory has beenissued to prevent coronavirus infection.The state’s health department has also launched a 24X7 helpline on which people can report about symptoms of the disease and history of travel from affected nations.In Video: Coronavirus scare: Indian students brought back from Wuhan celebrate at quarantine facility

Title: Officials delay in handing bldg meant for Colva panchayat to govt
Content:
This story is from February 5, 2020

Colva: Commercial business at the Colva panchayat ghar building continues even though the local body has cancelled the trade licences of the establishments operating there and has revoked the perpetual leases of all 10 shops.

An order was issued directing that the shops be sealed and that the collector take possession of the shops. The entire premises was then supposed to be handed over to the government.

In 1992, 500sqm of land belonging to the tourism department was handed over to the panchayat to build a panchayat ghar. However, instead of a housing the panchayat office, the building which was inaugurated in 2000 had 10 shops on its ground floor and a hall on the first floor, violating an agreement signed with the tourism department.

Repeated requests by the department to stop commercial activity at the premises were ignored. It finally directed South Goa collector Ajit Roy to take possession of the land and premises and hand it back to the government.

In October 2019, a showcause notice was issued to the panchayat by the collector asking why the land given to the local body for a panchayat ghar and community hall should not be handed back to the government. The panchayat then issued showcause notices to the lease holders of the shops. In its reply to the collector, the panchayat said it had issued showcause notices. The collector rejected the reply and in November, 2019, directed the mamlatdar to take possession of the Colva panchayat ghar within seven days.

Colva panchayat secretary, Amol Tilve said the talathi was ordered by Salcete mamlatdar Prataprao Gaonkar to seal the premises.

An order dated December 16, 2019, from Gaonkar directed Tilve to hand over the property to the talathi with seven days. However, it was not complied with. Another memorandum to this effect was sent to Tilve in January. It also stated that if the premises were not handed over to the talathi, they would be sealed and costs recovered from the secretary himself.

Tilve denied receiving the memorandum and said the mamlatdar could not direct him as his superior was the block development officer. He also said sealing of the premises needed to be done by the talathi because the Goa Panchayat Raj Act does not permit a secretary to do so. Tilve further said that one of the leaseholders of the shops had approached the district court and had received an ex parte order not to cancel the trade licence.

Title: TN: Remember, minor offence leads to major damage
Content:
This story is from February 5, 2020

Representative image

CHENNAI: Not halting before the stop line or scooting away before a red signal turns green may look like ‘minor’ traffic offences, but the two violations have killed more people in the state compared to drunk driving, distracted driving or driving down the wrong side. Yet police do nothing to stop the deadly menace, nor has the state government accepted the central government’s suggestion for a higher penalty .

Statistics from National Crime Records Bureau show that in 2018, 763 people died and 4,204 were injured in 3,807 accidents reported at traffic signals and stop lines. The number of accidents was three times higher than the number of accidents that occurred when the driver was drunk.

Besides putting the lives of road users at risk, these offences create chaos on the road, hamper movement of vehicles and cause bottlenecks.

“It’s the attitude,” said Dr Nappinnai Seran, consultant psychologist and counsellor in the Madras high court. “Many riders feel that waiting for a signal to turn green is a waste of time,” she said.

On Tuesday, TOI was a witness. The Council of Scientific and Industrial Research – an autonomous research body -- estimates at least 250 vehicles to cross the Nandanam Signal from Pasumpon Muthuramalinga Thevar Road and enter Venkatanarayana Road in T Nagar in one signal cycle (one minute). But only 150 crossed the signal because vehicles coming from Saidapet blocked half the lane in the opposite side.

But this isn’t a problem just at the Nandanam signal. It is everywhere. Worse, policemen ask two-wheeler riders to go past the stop line and wait for the signal to turn green. “Where is hope when police themselves are inviting public to violate rules,” asked R Dinesh, a resident of Nandanam.

Often, bikers rev up and cross roads between signals. “This can be dangerous in Chennai where distance between stop lines on opposite sides in a traffic signal is 100 metres or more. The risk of the violators hitting against those travelling in opposite direction is higher,” said S Kamal Soi member of National Road Safety Council.

More than 5,000 lost their lives in such accidents in Tamil Nadu between 2013 and 2018 – the highest in the country. Soi said automatic number plate recognition (ANPR) could be a deterrent.

But these machines come with the problem of plenty, something the Chennai City Traffic Police is bad at handling. In one day, more than 90,000 challans were generated by ANPR in Anna Nagar. But less than one-fourth of the violators were fined because the traffic police are yet to post the remaining challans. “We don’t have the staff who can post that many challan. We need automatic challan systems too,” said a senior police officer.

Rama Rao, president of Chennai Traffic and Transportation Forum, said police should use CCTV cameras at signals to fine violators. “Police at control room, monitoring CCTV footage, can manually take note of violators, generate challans and send them to their addresses,” he said.

Title: Amit Shah cuts short crowd’s chants of ‘goli maaro...’
Content:
Shah addressed a rally at Kondli for BJP candidate Rajkumar Dhillon (R). MP Gautam Gambhir was also present

NEW DELHI: “Goli maaro…” On Wednesday, as a worked-up crowd in east Delhi’s Kondli started the chant, they were cut short by Union home minister and senior BJP functionary Amit Shah “Arre suno bhai, suno bhai… Button dabao,” he said, later adding, “Bewakoofi band karo na bhaiyya”.The BJP star campaigner said if the party is voted to office, the people who talk about dividing the country, particularly JNU students Sharjeel Imam, Kanhaiya Kumar and Umar Khalid, will be behind bars.“Give us a mandate. In an hour’s time, after our government is formed, these three will be jailed as prosecution permission for them will be given by BJP,” Shah said, adding that the Arvind Kejriwal government had stalled prosecution of Kanhaiya and Khalid for more than a year.Shah addressed the public meeting at Kondli for BJP candidate Rajkumar Dhillon. He then visited Trilokpuri to support Kiran Vaid, campaigned for Anil Goyal at Krishna Nagar and for Anil Bajpai at Gandhi Nagar.“I have come to appeal that when you go to the booth with your family on February 8 and press the button with the lotus symbol, do not think that you are making the BJP candidate victorious. Think that you are ensuring the development and security of Delhi and the country,” Shah said.On Kejriwal’s challenge for a debate, Shah said he, too, wanted to ask the AAP chief questions regarding his development claims.“I challenge him to tell me how many of the 50 colleges have been built from 2015 till now? Bring the list. We will give the money to name them by advertising in newspapers. The truth is that Kejriwal did not build any colleges. No school was built. No development happened in AAP’s tenure in the past five years,” said Shah.On Ram Mandir, Shah said, “Aap chahte ho bhavya raam mandir bane? Toh Congress aur AAP ko vote mat do.”In Video: Delhi Elections: Amit Shah cuts short crowd chanting ‘goli maaro’ at Kondli rally

Title: The Northern Lights and my first brush with spirituality
Content:
This story is from February 5, 2020

The Northern Lights or the Aurora Borealis occur when highly charged electrons from the solar wind interact with elements in the Earth’s atmosphere near the North Pole.

The Lights symbolise all that is magical, mystical and unknown about the world. There are various myths and legends surrounding the Northern Lights. The locals believed that these dancing waves of colour are our powerful guardian spirits; the spirits of our ancestors who come to meet and bless us. The native Cree people called it the Dance of the Spirits.

Standing under the midnight sky, beneath the shining stars, in around minus 15 degrees Celsius and braving the bone-chilling 30 kmph wind speed, I wasn’t sure if it was a good decision to hunt for the Lights. Soon enough the Lights started casting their magic spell.

It is impossible to witness such a beautiful phenomenon without a sense of awe. I am not sure what the Lights are, but I am sure there is something very special about them.

Just like looking into the stars or gazing at a rainbow, sunset or other natural miracles, the Lights give us a feeling of awe and powerlessness — a knowing that there is something greater and more powerful than us and we can connect with them.

Just because we can explain them in scientific terms does not negate the spiritual reality. I didn’t know I was having a spiritual experience at that time, but looking back, that’s what I would say it was. Standing beside the bonfire and looking up at the Lights, I felt that my long gone near and dear ones came to greet me, to assure me that they are there to guide me. I felt an instant connection with all that is in nature. As if, I belonged there since the beginning of time.

This awe-inspiring and wordless state was spirituality for me. Everything came together at that moment — the Aurora, the Universe and Me.

When the Universe calls, stop and listen. You will receive blessings beyond measure. That is what I chose to do.

(The writer is a teacher by profession)

Title: Honest government worked day and night for you: Manish Sisodia
Content:
Manish Sisodia campaigned along with Bhagwant Mann, AAP MP from Punjab's Sangrur, at West Vinod Nagar

NEW DELHI: Even BJP workers accept that children in Delhi government schools are getting the best education , deputy chief minister Manish Sisodia claimed on Wednesday while addressing a public meeting at West Vinod Nagar falling under his assembly constituency, Patparganj “A prominent BJP worker, who had been campaigning against AAP’s education initiatives, recently took out his daughter from a private school and got her enrolled in a Delhi government school,” said the education minister, who was campaigning along with Bhagwant Mann , the party MP from Punjab’s Sangrur.Crediting school teachers and the education team for the improvement, he said, “Even at private schools, we never allowed any fee hike. In comparison, the fees at Noida and Ghaziabad schools are way higher.”On the development work in his constituency, the MLA said there was not even a single stretch in Patparganj that was not carpeted in the past five years. “Due to the rebates in electricity and water bills, 72,000 households are getting zero electricity bills here.”While earlier development work used to get delayed due to a corrupt system, “an honest government is now working day and night for the city”, Sisodia said, adding that he felt proud to be part of a government working for the uniform development of society.“This election is not about any particular party or candidate but about the kind of development and governance model people want to see in future,” the minister said while urging the crowd to vote for AAP if they wanted the government’s welfare schemes to continue.Mann also requested people to choose the real issues over the politics of polarisation. “I am sure the people in Delhi will vote for development over those trying to divide society on the basis of slogans.” Slamming BJP’s politics of arrogance, Mann said the election commission even had to act against some BJP’s functionaries. “Senior BJP MPs have only one issue — Shaheen Bagh. When your government has brought this law, it is your responsibility to find a solution.”Reminding the crowd that BJP is calling a chief minister who has worked hard a terrorist, Mann said, “February 8 is an opportunity to give answers to such people.”

Title: 04- CITIZEN PAGE MAILBOX
Content:
This story is from February 5, 2020

Gachibowli encroachment

Trucks are parked on the road throughout the day near HMWS&SB, Gachibowli section office, Financial District. As the road gets narrower, it causes a lot of problems for pedestrians. Even for commuters, it becomes a tough task negotiating the stretch. I request the authorities to look into the issue and take prompt action.

Shivam Srivastava

Road closure causing chaos

The closure of an arterial road leading to Park Hotel in Somajiguda and diversion of vehicles to the road leading to Katriya Hotel since the past week or so is creating severe traffic chaos. I am not aware of the reason for the closure, but I wish to draw attention to the increased movement of vehicles that is causing disturbance to residents in the area due to constant honking by impatient motorists trying to get ahead of each other. Earlier, while returning home from my office in Khairatabad, I used to take the Park Hotel / Necklace Road Station route. Now, I am have to drive all the way till Somajiguda Circle and then take a U-turn to reach home. It is a wastage of time and fuel. I request the authorities to kindly look into the issue.

R Sampath

No streetlights

The arterial roads in Nacharam does not have adequate streetlights and are filled with potholes. The area is far removed from the rest of the city making it vulnerable to higher rates of crime. There are also several engineering colleges on this stretch. Therefore, keeping in mind the safety of commuters along this route, I request authorities to ensure that the roads are well-light and in good condition.

Vamsi Krishna

Open dumping ground

The area around Hashmathpet lake has turned into a dumping ground. Those residing in and around Bowenpally use the area as a dumpyard and an open toilet. This has led to a rise in the pig population in the area, which is a serious health hazard. Though beautification work has begun at the lake, we hope that authorities don’t limit restoration works to the lake, but also consider the surrounding areas.

Asma Hafeez

Title: Andhra Pradesh: Govt sanctions Rs 100 crore for Vijayawada development projects
Content:
Representative image

VIJAYAWADA: A day after sanctioning Rs 125crore to build retaining walls along the banks of the Krishna, the state government on Tuesday allotted Rs 100crore for various developmental work and improving civic amenities in the city.The municipal administration department on Monday issued GO. RT No. 65 sanctioning the amount for around 99 development projects in the city.Vijayawada Municipal Corporation which is facing a severe financial crisis for the last five years failed to focus on development activities. Many projects were left incomplete for years. Commissioner Prasanna Venkatesh submitted some representations to the state government seeking funds for various development activities. Municipal minister Botsa Satyanarayana had kept a keen interest in the city and sanctioned funds for the projects on a priority basis.Vijayawada Central legislator and Brahmin Corporation Chairman Malladi Vishnuvardhan speaking to TOI said, “Telugu Desam government completely ignored the development of the city. They created hype in the city and promoted real estate. Many projects remained incomplete and the civic body was left alone in debts. Chief minister Jagan Mohan Reddy had assured that he will develop Vijayawada and fulfilled his promise by releasing around Rs. 100 crores for various development projects in the city.”We are focusing on community halls, CC roads, underground drains, community toilets and other infrastructure projects in the city, he added.Meanwhile, opposition parties alleged that the state government is issuing funds to the Vijayawada Municipal Corporation to gain in the coming municipal elections. “YSRCP is playing games with the sentiments of the public. The government which removed pensions for around 7000 beneficiaries in the city is claiming that they are committed to the welfare of the poor. The release of funds is to win a maximum number of seats incoming municipal election. These funds will remain on paper and the projects remain as a dream,” said Telugu Desam city president and MLC Buddha Venkanna.

Title: Aurangabad: Teacher booked for showing porn to three Class 8 girls
Content:
This story is from February 5, 2020

Representative image

AURANGABAD: A city-based school teacher has been booked by the police for allegedly showing pornographic content to three Class VIII girls.

Though the incident took place inside the teacher’s cabin on January 6, the family members of one of the girl students broke their silence earlier this month by writing a letter to the police commissionerate.

Police had visited the school for inquiry last weekend and had also recorded the statements of the girl students. “No offence, however, was registered in the case then as parents were unwilling to come forward,” investigating officer Ashlesha Patil said.

However, as the news about the incident spread within the school, police on Tuesday booked the teacher under the stringent Protection of Children from Sexual Offences (POCSO) Act, 2012.

Police have also slapped section 354d (foster personal interaction) of the Indian Penal Code (IPC) against the teacher. The offence was registered on the basis of recorded statements of the girl students with police being the complainant.

“The accused took the three students in his cabin on the pretext of some important work, but allegedly showed them a porn clip on his mobile. He later warned the students with dire consequence if they spoke about it to anyone,” police said.

The girls, however, shared the incident with some of their teachers and family members.

“One of the family members of the affected girl wrote a letter to the Damini squad of the city police through the police commissionerate. After that, women cops visited the school on two occasions over the past weekend. The girls’ statements were also recorded, but the parents were against registering an offence at that time. We have registered an offence against the teacher after several parents sought stern action against the teacher,” Patil said.

Meanwhile, the school management, which had merely transferred the teacher after the incident surfaced the first time, said the accused would be terminated from the services on Wednesday.

A section of parents also accused the school principal of being lenient towards the accused teacher. The principal, however, refuted such allegations. “There is no question of backing anyone. We have decided to terminate the teacher,” the principal said.

Title: Nirbhaya: HC to decide on hanging plea today
Content:
This story is from February 5, 2020

NEW DELHI: Can the Nirbhaya death row convicts be hanged separately, since at least two of them have exhausted their mercy plea? Delhi high court may answer this question on Wednesday as it gives verdict on the Centre’s plea challenging the stay by a trial court on execution of the four convicts, since one of them had filed a mercy plea before the President.

After an urgent hearing on Saturday followed by marathon proceedings on Sunday, Justice Suresh Kumar Kait had reserved orders on the Centre’s plea arguing that pendency of the mercy plea of one convict in a case of multiple death row inmates can’t be used as a ground to stay hanging of those who have exhausted all available legal options or are yet to exercise it.

A day after the trial court postponed indefinitely the execution of the four men, the Centre and Delhi Police had challenged it, accusing the condemned prisoners of “testing the patience of the nation”.

Before the HC website reflected that judgment will be pronounced on Wednesday, Nirbhaya’s parents on Tuesday mentioned the issue before Justice Kait and pleaded for an expeditious decision.

The trial court on January 7, had issued black warrants for the execution of all the four convicts in Tihar Jail at 7am on January 22. But they could not be hanged due to pendency of mercy petition of one of them. Later on January 17, the trial court fixed February 1 for the hanging at 6am, but the court was forced to stay the execution again as the counsel for three convicts — Pawan Gupta , Vinay Sharma and Akshay Thakur — urged it to adjourn the matter “sine die” saying their legal remedies were yet to be exhausted.

While the mercy plea of Mukesh Singh and Sharma were rejected by the President, Gupta has not yet filed it even as Thakur’s mercy plea filed on February 1 is pending.

Solicitor general Tushar Mehta had contended it is a deliberate and calculated design of the convicts to “frustrate mandate of law” by getting their execution delayed and they were not entitled to any more time. But advocate AP Singh — appearing for Gupta, Thakur and Sharma — had opposed the petition questioning the “hurry to execute the death sentence in this case only... Justice hurried is justice buried.”

The counsel for the convicts also protested against the fresh plea wondering how it can be entertained when the Centre was never a party in the case proceedings before the trial court. Senior advocate Rebecca John, appearing on behalf of Singh, had said that the “Centre has sought the setting aside of the order of the Patiala House court” when “an earlier HC order has clearly said that any order of the trial court should be challenged in apex court only.”

Title: Cane farmers to protest tomorrow
Content:
This story is from February 5, 2020

Ponda: Sugarcane cultivators from Dharbandora will protest the non-payment of dues, outside the Sanjivani Cooperative Sugar Factory, on Thursday morning. They alleged that chief minister Pramod Sawant had failed to keep his promise of paying them 70% of the price of their produce and said they have been receiving just 35% of their dues. During his visit to the factory last month, Sawant had assured the farmers that Sanjivani would procure sugarcane from them and that 70% of the price of the produce would be paid to them within 15 days of it being supplied to the factory.

Title: Tamil Nadu: Livestreaming of MBBS exam now, AI monitoring soon
Content:
This story is from February 5, 2020

Representative image

CHENNAI: To put a stop to mass cheating by medical students during examinations, the Tamil Nadu Dr MGR Medical University has asked all 35 examination centres across the state to live stream the exams. A team of officials are monitoring the live streams from a control room in Guindy. Some 12,000 students are writing the exams this year.

In 2019, the university barred two self-financing colleges — Madha Medical College and Hospital and Melmaruvathur Adiparasakthi Medical College — from conducting MBBS examinations after CCTV footage showed mass copying by students with even invigilators helping them out in some cases. An inquiry committee found students exchanging notes, passing answer scripts and dictating answers at the exam hall. This year, students of Madha Medical College are writing their exam at the university campus, while students Melmaruvathur college have been given a separate examination centre. “The second and third year examinations are going on now. They are being live streamed,” said university vice-chancellor Dr Sudha Seshayyan. The colleges will have to send the complete video footage of the examinations, she said. “We will caution or warn centres from the control room if we see any malpractice. We have started live streaming from Monday,” she said.

The university, she said was in talks with companies for an artificial intelligence-driven system which can monitor examination venues in real-time.

Technology is available to provide proactive automated directions through instant alerts during exams. “We are hoping to make the process more stringent to reduce malpractices. We can debar colleges from holding exams and students too will be asked to repeat examinations or be debarred if malpractices are detected,” she said.

Students are given bar-coded answer scripts for the exams. Question papers are now sent to examination centres half an hour before the examination. To prevent leak, exam centres should downloaded the question papers using unique password and print them out minutes before they hand it over to the students.

Title: Hindi literature’s gems still sparkle
Content:
This story is from February 5, 2020

Dr V S Jog addresses the gathering

Nagpur: “‘Lokgeet’ holds great significance in Hindi literature, the examples of which can be seen in some of the wonderful Bollywood songs,” said VS Jog, adding, “‘De de Allah ke naam pe de de’ is an amazing creation. It brings back childhood memories which are incomplete without the presence of a beggar in the locality.”

Speaking as chief guest on the topic ‘Bhartiya sahityat loksahityache sthan’, Jog explained the importance of folk literature in India, a subject that interests him immensely.

The programme staged at Vidharbha Sahitya Sangh (VSS), Sutabuldi, was organized by Grantha Sahavas of VSS in memory of Sarojini Babar on Monday.

Arundhati Vaidya, who conceptualized the event, gave a brief introduction about Sarojini Babar, saying, Maharashtra is richer due to her contribution in the field of folk literature. Babar was a renowned Marathi writer and a politician. She was considered one of the finest writers because of her contribution to various sections of literature. She has not only written novels but penned poems as well.

The programme, ‘Nandapeepa loksahityacha’, suggests that Babar is like a lamp that burns forever and holds a special place near god. “Babar’s contributions to folk literature are remarkable and evergreen, just like the lamp that never stops giving light. Her writing will live forever,” said Vaidya.

Various forms of literature were wonderfully presented to the audience. They included stories, poems, riddles and much more.

Abha Mude presented a story titled ‘Dhakneche akal’ written by Babar. The story revolves around two boys who defeat the demon with their wit and free their sister from his claws.

Shushma Mulmule explained the origin of ‘Ukhana’ in literature and recited several examples of the same. It was popular among married women as they directly would not mention their husband’s name.

Vijaya Raut laid emphasis on stories of God that he termed as ‘Devit katha’ in folk literature. Vasudha Vaidya shed light on ‘Kodya’ which means riddles. The programme was anchored by Vinita Hinge.

(Reporting by Janhavi Dave)

Title: Rein in matka, godgoddo, says Sudin
Content:
This story is from February 5, 2020

Porvorim: Before banning Goans from entering casinos, the state government should crackdown on local gambling matka and godgoddo business. Even those at the level of minister, MLA, sarpanch and panch are involved in these, former deputy chief minister Ramkrishna ‘Sudin’ Dhavalikar said in the assembly on Tuesday.

“Goans have been banned from going to casinos. But we also need to stop matka, godgoddo and then stop Goans from going to casinos. MLA, minister, sarpanch, panch are involved in this. Gambling is not good. There are those who go to dance bars. We should start from our friends in the House. We should start from under our nose. Only then we will go from darkness to light, as the governor had said while opening his address to the House,” said Dhavalikar, urging his fellow MLAs to refrain from gambling as well.

He said that Goans were being completely cheated over the Mhadei issue with 50% of the water already diverted.

When WRD minister minister Filipe Neri Rodrigues said that his department had been monitoring the situation on a day-to-day basis and asked how Dhavalikar had arrived on the figure of percentage of water diverted, Dhavalikar replied that it was “visible from the flow” when one observes from the river’s starting point in Goa.

“Yesterday there was a congratulatory motion on CAA, but the House has no time to discuss burning issues like Mhadei. Some say it is our mother,” said Porvorim MLA Rohan Khaunte. “Dhavalikar has said 50% of water has already been diverted. When salinity of the river water increases and people will be unable to cultivate fields, they will then know what the actual impact of the diversion is,” said Khaunte.

Title: Day after trial run of 1st Benz flyover, detailed project report of second ready
Content:
This story is from February 5, 2020

VIJAYAWADA: A day after holding a trial run along Benz Circle Flyover, authorities of Krishna district on Tuesday announced that they were ready with the detailed project report (DPR) for the second flyover. Traffic snarls have become prevalent on the National Highway at Benz Circle Junction with the movement of heavy vehicles. The first flyover was constructed at Benz Circle after a decade’s demand by the people.

The then Telugu Desam government proposed two flyovers on either sides of the national highway and work was started on one. The much-delayed project was completed on February 1. District collector A Md Imtiaz and police commissioner Ch Dwaraka Tirumala Rao monitored the trial run.

The collector said the project would be officially inaugurated by central ministers in March. He pointed out that the project could be called complete only after the construction of the second flyover. “We have now completed the first flyover.

Heavy vehicles travelling towards Chennai will now pass over the new flyover and land at Skew Bridge Junction. Similarly, traffic towards Kolkata will pass through the proposed second flyover,” Imtiaz said. “We are keeping all efforts to make the project a reality soon,” he asserted. Meanwhile, locals TOI spoke to expressed relief at the first flyover becoming operational. “It almost took 40 minutes to cross three traffic signals at executive club junction, Nirmala Centre and Benz Circle. Half of the highway traffic will now pass through the flyover. This is a major relief. We hope the Centre allocates funds for the second flyover soon,” said Kundeti Shalini, a student of Maris Stella College.

Title: Vid Lit Festival aims tobring back non-fiction
Content:
This story is from February 5, 2020

Nagpur: In the world of literature and books, non-fiction often takes a back seat when it comes to popularity and readership. To bring back the essence and beauty of non-fiction literature, the Vidarbha Literary Festival will be held in the city with the theme — ‘Non-fiction Back In Action’ — on February 8-9 at Chitnavis Centre, Civil Lines.

Eminent personalities and authors will grace the event with their words of wisdom, offering a potpourri of rich knowledgable and content.

Pawan Sarda, Festival Director, Vidarbha Literary Festival, said the event would be creative and different, a one-stop destination for all non-fiction lovers. “We have organized the festival keeping in mind the audiences who love to indulge in non-fiction read. These two days will be enriching for them and each session will have a takeaway for readers,” said Sarda.

Vidarbha Literary Fest will host over forty authors of national and international repute with amazing sessions and discussions. The moderators will be local citizens who are experts in subjects such as politics, climate change, social issues etc. “We have authors such as Abhijeet Bhaduri, Santosh Desai, Tony Joseph and many more. They have accepted our invitation and are looking forward to interacting with the readers of the city,” said Hemant Lodha, who will chair this literary festival.

This lit fest will offer an opening act to local authors and each one will address the session for a few minutes before the renowned authors take the stage. “The event will encourage authors from Vidarbha and boost their confidence,” added Sarda.

Organized by a group of non-fiction lovers, the event is an attempt to bring this genre of writing to the fore and connect like-minded people.

If you are someone who absolutely enjoys a non-fiction read, it will be a great opportunity to nourish your brain with wholesome and knowledgeable content.

“Apart from regular discussions, there will be an array of exciting events such as interactive sessions and writing workshops. We are looking forward to hosting the literary festival in a successful manner,” said Sachin Jahagirdar, the founder secretary of Vidarbha Literary Festival.

Title: Nirbhaya case: Rajya Sabha members from all parties express concern over delay
Content:
This story is from February 5, 2020

NEW DELHI: The Upper House on Tuesday continued to function in the pre-lunch session despite loud protests by opposition members over CAA, NRC and controversial remarks made by BJP leaders in the run-up to the Delhi elections.

After AAP member Sanjay Singh raised the Nirbhaya issue, MPs from all parties came together to demand speedy execution of the death sentence to the four convicts. Sloganeering stopped for a while when the Nirbhaya issue was brought up.

Chairman M Venkaiah Naidu said the matter was “very sensitive and serious” and the court judgement must be implemented at the earliest.

Singh earlier said while the entire country was on the streets following the gang rape and murder in 2012, the culprits have been able to get a new date every time to delay the execution. “Tarikh par Tarikh (date after date),” Singh said, while expressing frustration over the delay in execution of the death sentence.

TMC and Congress MPs, who were raising slogans against CAA, NRC and NPR, stopped sloganeering as the issue was discussed.

Observing that people are agitated and concerned over the delay in execution, Naidu said those in the system must fulfil their responsibilities.

He said the convicts were given all legal opportunities. “We cannot allow such things to go on in the country. People are getting restive. It must be seen that the judgement is implemented at the earliest,” he said.

Union Minister Prakash Javadekar blamed the Delhi government for the delay.

Earlier, some TMC MPs trooped into the Well of the House and started raising slogans like “Goli marna band karo” (Stop firing bullets) and “Loktantra ki hatya nahi chalegi” (Won’t tolerate murder of democracy).

The chairman, however, held his ground and ensured that members could raise issues listed for the Zero Hour.

Title: Secunderabad: Sewage spill plugged after resident complains on TOI app
Content:
This story is from February 5, 2020

SECUNDERABAD: After residents of Aswini Colony, West Marredpally, reported about overflowing sewage in their locality using TOI’s Citizen Reporter app, officials of Secunderabad Cantonment Board (SCB) swung into action and plugged the leakage. Residents said that the overflowing sewage had become a source of agony for them and they feared the spread of vector-borne diseases.

“Finally, our woes have come to end. The issue was fixed after we aired our grievances on the TOI app . I thank TOI and the authorities for fixing the issue,” said Janaki Lakshmi, the citizen reporter.

Savio M, a resident of West Marredpally, said the sewage spill had added to their commuting woes. “The road in Aswini Colony is filled with potholes. With sewage water overflowing, our commuting woes multiplied and further damaged the road too,” he said.

Another resident from East Marredpally said that additional measures should be taken even after the issue has been resolved. “Once the issues related to sanitation are solved, officials should take up fogging in the locality,” said Vikrantt Mohan, a resident of East Marredpally, while appreciating the Citizen Reporter app.

Officials of Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) said that they have forwarded the complaint to SCB. “Though GHMC officials inspected West Marredpally, they forwarded the complaint to SCB, as the locality falls under then,” read a statement issued by GHMC.

Officials of SCB said that the sewer lines were choked and so they overflowed. “We resolved the issue the day the grievance was published. However, the onus of keeping the city clean also lies on the residents. Many people throw garbage irresponsibly in nalas, blocking them,” said a SCB official.

Rama Krishna, vice-president of SCB, said that cleaning choked maholes was only a temporary solution. “The drainage lines are unable to bear the load. I am sure the manholes in West Marredpally will overflow again, even if there is a short spell of rain. Replacing the old lines with new and bigger ones is the only solution,” said Rama Krishna.

Title: Moving vigilance due to lack of space: AG
Content:
This story is from February 5, 2020

VIJAYAWADA: The state government on Tuesday told the high court that the decision to shift offices of vigilance commission and commissionerate of enquiries was due to space constraints at the secretariat and for administrative convenience.

A bench headed by Chief Justice J K Maheswari and Justice Ninala Jayasurya questioned advocate general why the decision was taken while the bills proposing decentralization of the capital were in pending in the upper house of the assembly and Public Interest Litigations challenging the bills were pending with the high court.

Karumanachi Indraneel Babu, advocate for the petitioner, said the government’s decision to shift the offices of vigilance commission and commissionerate of enquiries to Kurnool was illegal and arbitrary.

Advocate general S Sriram told the high court that the decision was taken due to lack of space at the secretariat. The Chief Justice asked the advocate general why the government wanted to shift the offices to Kurnool instead of creating space by constructing a building in Amaravati . The AG told the court that the government has taken a policy decision to shift the offices for administrative convenience.

At one stage, the Chief Justice said that the high court would maintain the status quo till the next hearing of the batch of petitions that challenge the bills proposing shifting of the capital from Amaravati as it was only a matter of two weeks.

The Chief Justice observed that the offices can continue to function from Amaravati for another 15 days as they were for the last two years. The advocate general, however, sought three days’ time to file counter affidavits in the matter.

As a lunch motion was moved by another petitioner over the same issue, the bench said they would resume the hearing post-lunch.

Lakshminarayana, advocate for the petitioner who moved the lunch motion, argued that both the offices were part of the capital which is notified under Capital Region Development Authority (CRDA) Act. He argued that the decision to shift the offices while CRDA Act was in force was illegal.

The AG said that there was no office of permanent nature at the secretariat for the vigilance commission. He said that the commissioner of enquiries would be formed based on specific requirement. He said both offices can function from anywhere in the state.

The high court asked the AG about the functions of vigilance commission and commissionerate of enquiries and under which statue these two offices were established. As the advocate general sought time to furnish the details, the HC posted the matter for further hearing to Wednesday.

Title: Vijai slams govt, says ruling side suffering talent deficit
Content:
This story is from February 5, 2020

Porvorim: Taking aim at the state government over various issues on Tuesday, GFP Fatorda legislator and former deputy chief minister Vijai Sardesai claimed that the ruling side was suffering from a “talent deficit”.

Sardesai, who spoke during a discussion on the motion of thanks to the governor ’s address called the ruling side “a float of 27 frogs” who were suffering from a “talent deficit” and have a psychological condition where “confidence stems from talent deficit”. He went on to say that science and technology minister Michael Lobo himself had made a statement that there is a talent deficit in the government.

The GFP president also said that governor Satya Pal Malik ’s address had some ‘lies’ such as wrong projections of GST collections.

Stating that the Mhadei water diversion issue was “a complete sellout of Goa”, Sardesai said Karnataka’s project, which is aimed at diverting the river’s water, costs more than Goa’s budget. He also that only after the governor had had a word with Prime Minister Narendra Modi, was the letter giving permission to Karnataka for the project on the Mhadei kept in abeyance.

“The governor’s speech in the House made him look artificial. It looked like when he spoke outside the assembly on the Mhadei, he was speaking from his heart. On January 7, it looked like he was just doing a job in the House,” he added.

While taking on chief minsiter Pramod Sawant , he said, “The chief minister announced in January that he would give 5,000 jobs. I have been told now in a written reply that it cannot be quantified. The announcement was nothing but a ‘chunnavi jumla’ (election gimmick) to win the upcoming zilla panchayat polls.”

Title: Stars to descend on city for Orange City Film Festival
Content:
This story is from February 5, 2020

NAGPUR: The fourth edition of the popular Orange City Film Festival will be held from February 7-9 and will be inaugurated on February 6 at Vanamati Auditorium in the presence of esteemed personalities such as Madhur Bhandarkar , Ashish Kulkarni, Nandu Madhav and actress Mukta Barve.

Jointly organized by the Orange City Cultural Foundation and the Nagpur Municipal Corporation (NMC) in association with Saptak and Pune Film Foundation , the four-day festival will screen over 30 full length Indian and foreign feature films at Inox, Jaswant Tuli Mall.

Chandrashekhar Meshram, chairman of the Orange City Cultural Foundation, said, “This film festival has been organized to celebrate the essence of contemporary cinema. We are looking forward to a good footfall, but seats will allotted on a first-come-first-served basis.”

The festival will offer an array of excellent cinema to be shown on two screens simultaneously at Inox Jaswant Tuli. There are a variety of Marathi and English movies to choose from.

The festival will open with the movie ‘Liza’s Tale’| Istorializy, directed by Alexander Zhovna from Ukraine, Russia.

Film and television personalities will inaugurate the program at Vanamati, which will give a kick-start to the four-day long film festival. “From the last four years we are organizing this film festival in collaboration with NMC and we have got excellent feedback. It is a great opportunity to enjoy good cinema and educate the audience about some of the films which they are not aware about,” said Meshram.

Like every year, the Orange City Cultural Foundation will be giving the award for ‘Outstanding contribution to Indian Cinema’. It will be presented to filmmaker and director Madhur Bhandarkar followed by an award for cultural foundation to Ashish Kulkarni, the animation guru. “Every year we honour renowned personalities from the field of cinema and people from Vidarbha, who have made a mark with their outstanding contribution,” added Meshram.

Title: Vijayawada: Bhavanipuram murder cracked
Content:
This story is from February 5, 2020

Representative image

VIJAYAWADA: City police on Tuesday arrested Bhavanipuram murder accused Gavirneni Anil Kumar (37), a resident of Chodavaram village in Penamaluru mandal .

Anil quit his job at a function hall and began targeting women who stay by themselves to make money, police said and added that he was “inspired” by crime reports in vernacular television news channels.

On January 31, he allegedly killed Yedupati Padmavati (56) by slitting her throat at her house in Pappula Mill Road under Bhavanipuram Police Station limits. Her family noticed that the jewellery she was wearing had gone missing.

The case was challenging for the police as it took place in a busy area and Anil Kumar sprinkled chilli powder at the crime scene with an intention to prevent sniffer dogs from identifying him. However, after verifying CCTV footage from multiple cameras in the vicinity and analysing mobile tower data logs the police zeroed in on Anil Kumar as the prime suspect in the case.

Upon scrutinising his recent transactions, they confirmed that Anil Kumar was behind the murder. Speaking to reporters on Tuesday, city police commissioner Ch Dwaraka Tirumala Rao said Anil Kumar’s modus operandi was to target women while they were alone in their houses. He would roam around the city looking for houses with doors kept open.

On July 10, 2019, Anil Kumar entered the house of one Nukala Sumalata and threatened her with a knife. He robbed her gold ornaments and ran away. He took a loan of about Rs 1.56 lakh from a bank by pledging the ornaments. On January 31, he entered Padmavati’s home when she was alone and killed her before fleeing with her gold. Cops recovered the knife used to kill Padmavati, Anil Kumar’s blood-stained cloths and the gold ornaments he pledged.

Title: Andhra Pradesh: 28 logs of red sanders seized, 6 held
Content:
This story is from February 5, 2020

Representative image

Continuing its offensive against red sanders smuggling, Chittoor district police wing arrested six red sanders smugglers and seized 28 logs in two separate incidents on Tuesday.

Acting on the directions of Chittoor superintendent of police S Senthil Kumar, checks were carried out at various places across the district to prevent the smuggling activities.

In the first incident at Iruvaram cross along the Chittoor-Palamaner highway, Chittoor II town police led by inspector P Yugandhar stopped two cars and seized 10 red sanders logs.

Three smugglers were also arrested. In another incident at Jodichinthala along the Chittoor-Gudiyatham road, Chittoor rural inspector C Lakshmikanth Reddy and his team chased a speeding SUV in the early hours of Tuesday and found 18 red sanders logs in the vehicle.

All three people travelling in the vehicle were arrested.

Title: Andhra Pradesh: Soon, water aerodrome at Prakasam barrage
Content:
This story is from February 5, 2020

VIJAYAWADA: In a bid to boost tourism in the city, the Andhra Pradesh government is all set to build a first-of-its-kind water aerodrome upstream of Prakasam barrage in the city. Krishna district administration, AP Tourism Authority and Andhra Pradesh Airports Development Corporation (APADC) on Tuesday conducted a ground-level inspection at Berm Park to verify the viability of establishing a water aerodrome.

Special chief secretary Karikal Valaven, APADC chief executive officer (CEO) Neena Sharma Krishna, district collector A Md Imtiaz and a team of engineers inspected the viability of landing and take off of aircraft on the Krishna.

AP Tourism is eyeing to run special services to Papikondalu, Vishakapatnam and Hyderabad to promote tourism packages.

“Prakasam barrage has huge potential to attract tourists. Water sports gave new shape to Berm Park and Bhavani Islands . The water aerodrome project will take the project to new heights. We are checking all possibilities to bring the project to the city soon,” Imtiaz said.

Title: Inmate at Mandoli Jail plans Rs 50-lakh robbery, five caught
Content:
This story is from February 5, 2020

Representative image

NEW DELHI: Despite being lodged in Mandoli Jail , a 30-year-old man managed to plan a robbery of Rs 50 lakh . The incident occurred on January 20. Asif arranged for the logistics and the weapons to help his accomplices rob the employees of a construction firm in Keshavpuram .

Police have recovered Rs 28.74 lakh, three pistols and the motorcycle on which they carried out the robbery.

“Other accused have been identified as Zahid (36), Asif Ali (24), Chand Mohammad (26), Radha Ballabh Sharma (36) and Dilip (27). With their arrest, six cases of robberies, which occurred in Keshavpuram, Bara Hindu Rao, Roop Nagar, New Friends Colony, Pandav Nagar and Jamia Nagar, have been cracked,” said Vijayanta Arya, DCP (Northwest).

The prime accused, Asif, hails from Etah in Uttar Pradesh. He is lodged in Mandoli Jail and has over 30 cases of robbery, snatching and arms act registered against him. “He was in constant touch with his associates through a mobile phone and planned the entire robbery,” said a source.

Jail authorities, however, said that the police were yet to inform them in this regard.

On January 20, two employees of a construction firm were robbed of Rs 50 lakh by four people. Raj Hans and Bhupendra were on the way to their office in Rohini when they were stopped by the accused men and robbed. One of the accused had brandished a gun to scare the employees, who were carrying the bag given by their employer.

Based on clues from CCTV footage, police teams had conducted several raids and arrested Dilip. During interrogation, he revealed the names of his associates as Zahid, Asif Ali and Chand Mohammad. The trio told the police that they were members of Asif’s gang.
